meanings.definition: The act of causing things to happen at the same time or speed.
meanings.sent1: The synchronisation of the dancers' movements was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The music and lights were in perfect synchronisation during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The synchronisation of the traffic lights made the city feel like a dance floor.
meanings.sent4: In nature, the synchronisation of fireflies lighting up creates a magical display.
meanings.sent5: The synchronisation of the clocks ticking created a soothing rhythm in the room.

meanings.definition: The coordination of events to operate simultaneously.
meanings.sent1: The synchronisation of the team's efforts led to a successful project completion.
meanings.sent2: The synchronisation of the gears in the machine ensured smooth operation.
meanings.sent3: The synchronisation of the chef's cooking made the kitchen a symphony of flavors.
meanings.sent4: The synchronisation of the birds flying in formation was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The synchronisation of the traffic flow kept the city moving efficiently.
